TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: And the "Vld" part?

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Kerdinand said:
> 
> 
> Then I pronounce the letters, one after one, all in german.
> 

[@Kobymaru](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/107372-kobymaru/)
How do we delete our own posts? I can't seem to do it. Also, are you able to remove them?
Users are not currently able to remove their own posts, if you need one removed just report it and ask. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
how do you like.. um rep other person on mobile? (is it click the plus icon???)

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Joshwoo69 said:
> 
> 
> how do you like.. um rep other person on mobile? (is it click the plus icon???)
> 

Click the blue "like" button with the little heart on it. In my testing this button does not disappear no matter how narrow the page is made, is it not visible for you?

> 
> 
> 11 hours ago, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> Click the blue "like" button with the little heart on it. In my testing this button does not disappear no matter how narrow the page is made, is it not visible for you?
> 

it is visible.

Why was "kraken" removed from the profanity filter?  At least, I think it was... 

ETA: Someone's messing with the filter!  na-zi kraken nazis <-Testing!

ETA2: The plural form is still not censored.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-13T22:50:59Z" title="12/13/2015 10:50  PM" data-short="8 yr">December 13, 2015</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**

> 
> 
> 14 hours ago, Mad Rocket Scientist said:
> 
> 
> Why was "kraken" removed from the profanity filter?  At least, I think it was... 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ETA: Someone's messing with the filter!  na-zi kraken nazis <-Testing!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ETA2: The plural form is still not censored.
> 

Why should "kraken" have been in the filter at all? It is a normal word, and very common in KSP. IIRC it could be used as long as I was here.

I agree about that second word, though.

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, Kerdinand said:
> 
> 
> Why should "kraken" have been in the filter at all? It is a normal word, and very common in KSP. IIRC it could be used as long as I was here.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I agree about that second word, though.
> 

Nope, that's the n-word being changed into "kraken." Like this: "kraken"

kraken?

huh, you're right. Now I'm going to think that my ships get attacked by space nazis. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

Let's get back to the point, please.
How do I change my avatar?

> 
> 
> 24 minutes ago, Aghanim said:
> 
> 
> How do I change my avatar?
> 

Click your username, then "Profile". Then click the small gray square that appears on your avatar, that will let you upload a new avatar.

Can mods post in locked threads?

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, mipmo said:
> 
> 
> Can mods post in locked threads?
> 

Yes. Most threads in Announcements are locked as soon as they are published, yet mods can post updates to these. Maybe lower-rank moderators cannot post in threads locked by higher-rank mods, but I doubt it.

EDIT: woop, 1000th post ! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-04T17:28:44Z" title="01/04/2016 05:28  PM" data-short="8 yr">January 4, 2016</time> by Gaarst**

> 
> 
> 57 minutes ago, Gaarst said:
> 
> 
> Yes. Most threads in Announcements are locked as soon as they are published, yet mods can post updates to these. Maybe lower-rank moderators cannot post in threads locked by higher-rank mods, but I doubt it.
> 

The concept of ranks is somewhat disused, everyone is equal except [@sal_vager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/16426-sal_vager/) and [@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/), who rule over the proceedings with an iron fist\* ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)").

\*please don't fire me
How did you guys get into the moderation team for the KSPForum?

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, SpaceplaneAddict said:
> 
> 
> How did you guys get into the moderation team for the KSPForum?
> 

Some were recruited by senior moderators, others volunteered when a public call for moderators was made.

> 
> 
> On December 7, 2015 at 3:40 PM, adsii1970 said:
> 
> 
> Oh, Ok. makes sense to me. We had to do that in one of the forums I moderated for for SimCity. The only problem we ran into with the IP addresses is that if the original spammer used Internet access from a university, library, or other public area, and we blocked the IP address, we would often (and unavoidably) block access to those with legitimate accounts that had the same IP as the offending party. Now granted, that was about four years ago, so I am assuming that different protocols are in place or are you using a combination of IP, user name, and email addresses?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> We even tried shady looking email domains, but because a large number of our spammers had either Yahoo! or Excite email addresses, we could not place that entire email domain on the rejection list...
> 

Hey! I use Yahoo!

![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

well my mom made me that email, but I'm too lazy to switch.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-05T06:46:06Z" title="01/05/2016 06:46  AM" data-short="8 yr">January 5, 2016</time> by legoclone09**

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> Hey! I use Yahoo!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")
> 
> 
> 
> well my mom made me that email, but I'm too lazy to switch.
> 

And that is exactly why we didn't ban the entire domain. Even though Excite and Yahoo! (and a few domains) did have a bunch of spambots associated with them, we decided that it was better to catch ten spambots than to have one innocent user, simply because of their domain, refused access to the forum. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") It is never wise to punish the innocent with the guilty in the name of "justice" or "equality."

As a side note, I have had my hotmail address since 1992... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
I see some moderators I don't recognize popping up on the forums. Has some new blood been recruited?
